tweets.text:
40 IIT aspirants from one village‚Äîin ONE year!
You read that right. Patwa Toli in Bihar has become a quiet revolution in rural education. 

Behind it: a free, volunteer-driven coaching centre, Vriksha Sansthan, that provides everything from books to laptops‚Äîand mentors from IIT Bombay.
All this in a village that once knew only the whirr of looms.

Now, it‚Äôs shaping the tech minds of tomorrow.

#VillageOfIITians #RuralIndiaRising #IITSuccessStory #BiharInspires #EducationForAll #VrikshaSansthan #FutureEngineers

#dblive  #bihar #nitishkumar #PMModi https://t.co/2HHdohQSGk

The Pahalgam attack has shocked many but why ?

Over the last 2 years, you saw many Biharis being killed similarly by gunshots. They showed you the trailer but you chose to ignore. 

After all, the ones who were dying were poor & Biharis. How does their lives even matter ? Never did we see any condolences from any leadership. 

Now when the rich have died , one of their own has died, everyone is angry. The same Biharis are angry who were never angry when their own died. I am angry too but I hope you show the same anger when the next time another Bihari dies next time. 

Let's take a moment and pray for their souls too. Bihari lives matter.

tweets.text:
Worse than the Bihar fodder scam‚Ä¶ AP‚Äôs land scam exposed!

Under the guise of allotting land to companies at lower rates, @ncbn, @naralokesh handed over land worth hundreds of crores in Vizag to shady companies ‚Äî at just 99 paise per acre.

Back then, he floated a fake company named IMG Bharat with Billie Rao and hurriedly allotted 400 acres in Gachibowli. Now, the same trick is being played ‚Äî allocating land worth ‚Çπ3,000 crores to Ursa, another bogus company.

Adding to the scandal, TDP MP Kesineni Sivanath (Chinni), an engineering college classmate and business partner of Satish Abburi, who is also one of the directors, is deeply linked to these shady dealings. The truth is coming to light, and the people are not blind to this web of corruption.

First, land is quietly allotted to TCS to avoid suspicion. Then, massive land parcels are handed over to fake companies of their choice.

With the truth out, the alliance government is caught red-handed ‚Äî neither able to swallow it nor spit it out.

#ScamsterBabu
#Visakhapatnam

#CorruptionKingCBN

According to the latest opinion poll by C-Voter, Tejashwi Yadav's popularity has seen a significant rise among the potential chief ministers of Bihar. Following are the survey figures. 

- Tejashwi Yadav: 36%
- Nitish Kumar: 15%
- Samrat Choudhary: 13%
- Chirag Paswan: 06%

It is worth noting that Tejashwi Yadav's individual popularity is higher than the combined popularity (34%) of the NDA alliance. Thus, this result indicates a significant change in the political dynamics of Bihar. In the context of the upcoming assembly elections, analysis of these figures will play a vital role in determining the political direction of Bihar.

@yadavtejashwi

tweets.text:
BJP's claims that Bihar is recieving special treatment is utterly nonsense and misleading.

Claim 1 : Bihar got 10,000+ Cr budget
Fact : True but states with much smaller population got more money be it WB, Gujarat, Odisha,MP, Maharashtra etc. in reality, Bihar is getting much lesser than other states 

Claim 2 : Rail budget for Bihar increased 9 times.
Fact : It incresed 9-20 times for all states. It's because the size of the overall budget has increased. Our household budgets have also increased due to inflation.

To conclude, Railways is giving Bihar much less compared to other states. Considered per capita, it becomes negligible.

No surprise that our stations don't even have good platforms.
tweets.cleaned_text: bjp s claims that bihar is recieving special treatment is utterly nonsense and misleading claim 1 bihar got 10 000 cr budget fact true but states with much smaller population got more money be it wb gujarat odisha mp maharashtra etc in reality bihar is getting much lesser than other states claim 2 rail budget for bihar increased 9 times fact it incresed 9 20 times for all states it s because the size of the overall budget has increased our household budgets have also increased due to inflation to conclude railways is giving bihar much less compared to other states considered per capita it becomes negligible no surprise that our stations don t even have good platforms

AMAZING üö® A single village in Bihar, Patwatoli, has witnessed 40 students pass the JEE Mains Examination ü´°

Over the past 25 years, the village has produced dozens of IITians. It is often referred to as Bihar's "IIT factory."

In 1991, Jitendra Patwa became the first student from the village to secure admission at an IIT. 

Inspired by his achievement, many others followed suit. 

Today, it's said that almost every household in Patwa Toli has at least one engineer.
